alert.note: Alert for Latimer (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 04 at 4:04PM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 715 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Oklahoma, including the following county, Latimer. * WHEN...Until 715 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 404 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Mill Creek, Cunneo Tubby Creek, Fourche Maline, Little Fourche Maline, Long Creek, Clear Creek, Camp Creek, Pigeon Creek, Chickasaw Creek, Mountain Fork, Red Oak Creek, Gaines Creek, Rock Creek, Bandy Creek and Brazil Creek. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Wilburton... Red Oak... Panola... - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
